data.event: It was founded in 1879 under the name Las Casas.
The name was changed to Palmira and the community was incorporated in 1940.
In 1943 the municipality was divided into the barrios of Primero, Segundo, Arango y Escarza.

After the national municipal reform of 1976, it counts 6 consejos populares: Palmira Sur and Palmira Norte for the town, and the villages of Arriete-Ciego Montero, Espartaco, Elpidio GÃ³mez and San Fernando de Camarones.
